sections.title: Introduction and task overview
sections.summary: Presenter introduces the objective: implementing unit tests (specifically for AI search endpoints) using Copilot.
key_actions: State the task: implement unit tests for AI search
Identify the importance of unit tests to avoid regressions

sections.title: Identify missing tests and affected endpoints
sections.summary: The presenter inspects the codebase and notes missing tests for the AI search endpoint and possibly the formal search, deciding these need coverage.
key_actions: Review endpoints to find missing unit tests
Decide testing scope (AI search, formal search)

sections.title: Switch to Copilot agent mode and create chat
sections.summary: Switches Copilot to agent/assistant mode and opens a new chat to start the automated unit test implementation workflow; notes ability to return to previous chats.
key_actions: Switch Copilot to agent mode
Create a new chat
Note option to return to previous chat

sections.title: Select AI Search context and choose model
sections.summary: Selects the AI Search context for the agent and picks a model (GPT-5 in this case), with a reminder that model choice is switchable.
key_actions: Select 'AI Search' context in the agent
Choose GPT-5 model (or switch if desired)

sections.title: Trigger task via hashtag and start analysis
sections.summary: Uses a hashtag/task selector to request 'implement unit tests' for AI search. Explains that Copilot will read the entire solution, add code, build, and iterate.
key_actions: Type hashtag and select 'implement unit tests' task
Confirm task scope (AI Search)
Allow Copilot to analyze the solution

sections.title: Copilot analysis and iterative code changes
sections.summary: Copilot reads the codebase, generates new tests and code, attempts to build, and iterates to resolve issues. This is an automated multi-step process that can take time.
key_actions: Wait while Copilot analyzes solution
Allow Copilot to add new test files/code
Let Copilot attempt build and iterate on failures

sections.title: Build failure, dependency fixes, and final successful build
sections.summary: Initial build failed due to missing dependencies. Copilot added necessary dependencies and re-ran the build which then succeeded. Two new unit tests were created.
key_actions: Inspect build failure messages
Add missing dependencies (automated by Copilot)
Rebuild solution
Confirm build success and presence of new tests

sections.title: Accept changes and run tests via Test Explorer
sections.summary: Presenter accepts the changes made by Copilot, opens the Test Explorer, and runs the tests (including 'Run All') to verify the new unit tests for the AI products component.
key_actions: Accept Copilot's code changes
Open Test Explorer
Run all tests / run specific new tests
Verify new 'products AI' tests are listed and passing

sections.title: Next steps: expand scope to full-solution test coverage
sections.summary: Mentions the planned next scenario: instruct Copilot to check the entire solution for missing unit tests and implement them.
key_actions: Plan a broader request: check whole solution for missing unit tests
Prepare to run the next Copilot workflow

main_topics: Using Copilot (agent mode) to implement unit tests
Identifying missing tests for AI search endpoints
Selecting model/context in Copilot (AI Search, GPT-5)
Automated code analysis, generation, and iterative builds
Resolving dependencies and confirming successful builds
Running and verifying tests in Test Explorer
video: brk447-04 Add single unit Test for AI Search.mkv
